results.title: The Hooley-Dooleys: pop
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley and Hooley Dooleys Touring Company
results.brief_description: It’s a rainy day and the Hooley Dooleys and their friends Russell the Muscly Kangaroo and Tickle the Doodat are disappointed because they can’t go to the park. Things don’t turn out too badly when they decide to put on a pretend concert in Tickle’s playroom, and they each take it in turns to either entertain or be part of the audience. Features the following songs; “We are the Hooley Dooleys”, “Hello you’ve got the rhythm”, “Ten fingers splashing in the puddles”, “Police car”, “Peek-a-boo ping pong ball”, “Kangaroo”, “Hands and feet sailing”, “The Hooley Dooley’s ball”, “Photograph diddley dee”, “Mowing”, “If I was”, “Drums”, and “Everybody”.

results.title: The Honeymooners
results.creator_credit: Frank Satenstein, Jack Hurdle, CBS and Jackie Gleason Enterprises
results.brief_description: The Honeymooners was a popular television comedy that started as a sketch show and due to its success was produced as a series. The live show was set in a Brooklyn apartment focusing on two lower middle class neighbouring couples trying to make their lives better. The main character Ralph (Jackie Gleason), a bus driver, is constantly at loggerheads with his wife, Alice (Audrey Meadows) who always make up by the end of the show. This video presentation includes one episode, “TV or not TV” and a montage tribute of the show presenting highlights and memorable moments. The episode shows what happens when the couples decide to jointly own a television set and the strains it places on their friendship. Interestingly “The Flintstones” cartoon was based on the characters from “The Honeymooners” placing them in a pre-historic setting.

results.title: The Holy Year of 1950
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: St Peter’s Basilica setting for an inspiring series of religious functions in 1950. Pilgrims on their way to Rome attend the opening of the Holy Year 1950. Thousands of pilgrims attend open air mass in St Peter’s Square with Pope Pirest 12th. Shows the art and architecture of Rome.

results.title: The Holden Story
results.brief_description: The Holden Story traces the company’s history from its earliest days as a mass producer of harness to the Australian Boer War contingent through to the latest developments in automotive factories which will change the face of tomorrow’s industry. “The Holden Story” is a story of optimism and depression, national pride and international competition. Rated: G

results.title: The Hoffnung symphony orchestra [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas, BBC-TV and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A light hearted look at the various instruments of the orchestra, based on the original cartoons of the late Gerard Hoffnung, satirising musical pomposity. The music was composed and conducted by Francis Chagrin, who collaborated with Hoffnung on many occasions.

results.title: The Hoffnung Palm Court Orchestra
results.creator_credit: John Halas, British Broadcasting Corporation and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
It is the late 19th century in the lounge of an expensive hotel, where the Palm Court Orchestra is playing to a tea drinking audience. A fire starts and the hotel is soon ablaze, the people flee, but the orchestra plays on. In a series of other situations the orchestra also plays on. Based on a series of cartoon drawings by Gerard Hoffnung.

results.title: The History of inventions
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Bozzetto claims that it was lightning that first showed man the wonders of fire and set him on the hazardous parth of invention. Since primitive times man’s inventive itch has never been at rest; now we find ourselves living on a planet so endangered by our inventions that we may well have to escape to another world to find the peace necessary to go on inventing. In Italian.

results.title: The Historic route
results.creator_credit: Yemi Lijadu and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Ethiopia has the most remarkable collection of monuments in the whole of Africa apart from the Mediterranean area, and the “historic route” is the richest in the country. The restoration and preservation of monuments as well as the development of sites are essential elements in the growth of tourism in the country’s economy.

results.title: The Highland Maya: a case study in economic anthropology
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Modern day Maya in the highlands of Mexico and Guatemala have fused the burdens of service to ancient gods and to the Christian God into the cargo system, during which a man must work his way up through four levels, paying out large amounts of money to the church, in order to gain prestige. Corn farming is no longer sufficient to pay the cargo, so that they often have to sell their labour to landowners far away from their homes. At the end of each year the cargo is passed to the next man and the next stage is undertaken.
results.title_for_label: The Highland Maya: a case study in economic anthropology
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
